problem.markdown:
>>The time that a part spends in a factory beyond the time required for its operation is: <<
( ) About zero in a properly-designed factory. ( ) About the same time as the amount a part spends being operated on. ( ) About twice times the total operation time. (x) Often 10 to 100 times the total operation time.
[Explanation] The sum of all the delays that are part experiences during production is the extra time that a part spends in a factory, beyond the time required for its operations. Delay is inevitable, such as those caused by machine stoppages in the form of failures, maintenance blocking, starvation, and set up changes.
[Explanation]
